 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">ILLINOIS TOOL WORKS INC. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:180px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="7">ILLINOIS TOOL WORKS INC. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="line-height:0px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:2px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5">Notice of 2015 Annual Meeting and
Proxy Statement </FONT></P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P>&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center">


<IMG SRC="g821225g51g30.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
 </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="4"><B>Illinois Tool Works Inc. </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:10px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><center> <P STYLE="line-height:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000;width:71%">&nbsp;</P></center>
<P STYLE="margin-top:10px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Notice of Annual Meeting of Stockholders </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:10px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><center>
<P STYLE="line-height:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000;width:71%">&nbsp;</P></center> <P STYLE="margin-top:10px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Friday,
May&nbsp;8, 2015 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>9:00&nbsp;A.M. Central Daylight Time </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Illinois Tool Works Inc. </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>155 Harlem Avenue* </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Glenview, Illinois 60025 </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">If you plan to attend the meeting, you must be a holder of Illinois Tool Works Inc. shares as of the record date of March&nbsp;10, 2015,
and obtain a registration confirmation (&#147;Ticket&#148;) in advance. Tickets can be printed by accessing Shareholder Meeting Registration at <U><I>www.proxyvote.com</I></U> and following the instructions provided. You will need the 12 digit
number that is printed in the box marked by the arrow <FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:'WINGDINGS 3'">&#103;</FONT>&nbsp;included on your proxy card or Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials. Tickets will be available to registered and
beneficial owners and to one guest accompanying each registered and beneficial owner.&nbsp;You <B>must</B> bring your ticket to the meeting to gain access.&nbsp;Requests for admission tickets will be processed in the order in which they are
received.&nbsp;Please note that seating is limited and requests for tickets will be accepted on a first-come, first-served basis. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>*</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Enter the campus from Waukegan Road at Overlook Drive. Signage will direct you to the meeting location. </B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Illinois Tool Works Inc. (&#147;ITW&#148;) is holding its 2015 Annual Meeting for the following purposes: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">1.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">To elect the eleven directors named in this proxy statement for the upcoming year; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">To ratify the appointment of Deloitte&nbsp;&amp; Touche LLP as ITW&#146;s independent registered public accounting firm for 2015; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">3.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">To hold an advisory vote on executive compensation; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">4.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">To approve the Illinois Tool Works Inc. 2015 Long-Term Incentive Plan; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">5.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">To consider a non-binding stockholder proposal, if properly presented, to permit stockholders to call special meetings; and </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">6.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">To conduct any other business as may be properly brought before the meeting. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Only stockholders of record at the close of business on March&nbsp;10, 2015 are entitled to vote. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Our annual report to stockholders for fiscal year 2014 is enclosed with this proxy statement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV ALIGN="right">
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="40%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE">

</TABLE></DIV>  <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">March 20, 2015 </FONT></P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>IMPORTANT NOTICE REGARDING THE AVAILABILITY OF PROXY MATERIALS FOR THE ANNUAL MEETING OF STOCKHOLDERS TO
BE HELD MAY 8, 2015: The Illinois Tool Works Inc. 2014 Annual Report to Stockholders, including the Annual Report on Form 10-K, and its 2015 Proxy Statement are available on the Company&#146;s website at <U>www.itw.com</U> under the &#147;Investor
Relations&#148; link. Paper copies are available without charge upon written request to the Company&#146;s address above, Attention: Secretary. </B></FONT></P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<div style="width:100%;margin-left:0%; margin-right:0%;border:solid 1pt;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:3px"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-top:12px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="4"><B>Your Vote is Important </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%;margin-right:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Whether or not you plan to
attend the meeting, please vote as soon as possible. Under New York Stock Exchange rules, your broker will NOT be able to vote your shares on Proposals 1, 3, 4 or 5 unless they receive specific instructions from you.</B> If you hold your shares
through a bank or brokerage account, we strongly encourage you to return the voting instruction card to your bank, broker or other holder of record so that your vote is counted. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%;margin-right:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>We encourage you to vote by internet or telephone.</B> It is convenient for you and saves us significant postage and
processing costs. Please see the section entitled &#147;How do I vote&#148; on page 3 for instructions on how to vote your shares. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:12px; margin-left:2%;margin-right:2%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>We have been advised that some states are strictly enforcing unclaimed property laws and requiring shares held in &#147;inactive&#148; accounts to be escheated to the state in which the stockholder was
last known to reside. One way you can show that your account is active is to vote your shares.</B> </FONT></P></div>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">i </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="4"><B><A NAME="tx821225_1"></A>Questions and Answers about the 2015 Annual Meeting and Voting
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>What am I voting on and how does the Company&#146;s Board recommend that I vote? </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The Company&#146;s Board solicits your vote on the following proposals: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="75%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="3%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="20%"></TD></TR>


<TR STYLE="font-size:1pt">
<TD HEIGHT="8" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px">&nbsp;</TD>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Proposal Submitted for Vote</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Board&nbsp;Recommendation</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The election of the eleven directors named in this proxy statement for the upcoming
year</FONT></TD>

registered public accounting firm for 2015</FONT></TD>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">An advisory vote on executive compensation</FONT></TD>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Approval of the Illinois Tool Works Inc. 2015 Long-Term Incentive Plan</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A non-binding stockholder proposal to permit stockholders to call special

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Any other business as may be properly brought before the meeting</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Who may vote? </B></FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Stockholders at the close of business on March&nbsp;10, 2015, the record date, may vote. On that date, there were 373,322,688 shares of ITW common stock outstanding. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>How many votes do I have? </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Each share of ITW common stock that you own entitles you to one vote. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>How do I vote? </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">You may vote your shares in one of the following four ways:
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="18%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="5%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="77%"></TD></TR>


<TR STYLE="font-size:1pt">
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">1.&nbsp;&nbsp;By&nbsp;telephone:</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&nbsp;&nbsp;See the instructions at <U>www.proxyvote.com</U>; or</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.&nbsp;&nbsp;By&nbsp;Internet:</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&nbsp;&nbsp;See the instructions at <U>www.proxyvote.com</U>; or</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">3.&nbsp;&nbsp;By mail:</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&nbsp;&nbsp;If you received a printed copy of these proxy materials by mail, by</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&nbsp;&nbsp;signing, dating and mailing the enclosed proxy card; or</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">4.&nbsp;&nbsp;In&nbsp;person:</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&nbsp;&nbsp;Attend our Annual Meeting, where ballots will be provided.</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">If you vote by telephone or Internet, you should have your proxy card or E-Proxy Notice in hand when you call or go to the
proxy vote site. If you hold your shares through a bank or broker that does not offer telephone or Internet voting, please complete and return your proxy card by mail. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>When must I submit my vote by Internet or by phone? </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">If you vote by
Internet or by phone, you must transmit your vote by 10:59&nbsp;p.m., Central&nbsp;Time, on May&nbsp;7, 2015. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>If I hold shares through an
ITW Savings and Investment 401(k) Plan, when must I submit my vote? </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Shares held through an ITW 401(k) plan must be voted
by 10:59&nbsp;p.m., Central Time, on May&nbsp;5, 2015 in order to be tabulated in time for the meeting. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">3 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>How does discretionary voting authority apply? </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><I>Stockholders of Record.</I>&nbsp;&nbsp;If you are a stockholder of record and you vote by proxy, the individuals named on the proxy
card (your proxies) will vote your shares in the manner you indicate. If your proxy card does not indicate how you want to vote, your proxy will be voted &#147;FOR&#148; the election of each director nominee, &#147;FOR&#148; the ratification of the
appointment of Deloitte&nbsp;&amp; Touche LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm, &#147;FOR&#148; approval of ITW&#146;s executive compensation, &#147;FOR&#148; the proposal to approve the Illinois Tool Works Inc. 2015 Long-Term
Incentive Plan, &#147;FOR&#148; the non-binding stockholder proposal to permit stockholders to call special meetings, and &#147;FOR&#148; or &#147;AGAINST&#148; any other properly raised matter at the discretion of Susan&nbsp;Crown, Robert S.
Morrison and Pamela B. Strobel, or any one of them. <I> </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><I>Beneficial Owners.</I>&nbsp;&nbsp;If your shares are held in a
brokerage account or by a nominee and you do not provide your broker or nominee with voting instructions, the broker or nominee may represent your shares at the meeting for purposes of obtaining a quorum, but may not exercise discretion to vote your
shares at the meeting unless the proposal is considered a routine matter. The only matter being proposed for stockholder vote at the 2015 Annual Meeting that is considered a routine matter is the proposal to ratify the appointment of
Deloitte&nbsp;&amp; Touche LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm. As a result, in the absence of voting instructions from you, your broker or nominee will not have discretion to vote on the election of directors, ITW&#146;s
executive compensation, or the proposals to approve the Illinois Tool Works Inc. 2015 Long-Term Incentive Plan or the non-binding stockholder proposal. If you are a beneficial owner, it is important that you provide instructions to your bank, broker
or other holder of record so that your vote is counted. <I> </I></FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>May I revoke my proxy? </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">You may revoke your proxy at any time before it is voted at our Annual Meeting in one of four ways: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">1.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Notify our Secretary in writing before our Annual Meeting that you wish to revoke your proxy; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Submit another proxy with a later date; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">3.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Vote by telephone or Internet after you have given your proxy;&nbsp;or </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">4.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Vote in person at our Annual Meeting. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Why
didn&#146;t I receive a paper copy of the proxy statement and annual report? </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Unless our stockholders have requested paper
copies, we are furnishing proxy materials through the Internet. If you received a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (E-Proxy Notice) by mail or electronically, you will not receive a printed copy of the proxy materials unless you
specifically request one. Instead, the E-Proxy Notice provides instructions on how you may access and review our proxy materials online. The E-Proxy Notice also instructs you on how you may submit your proxy via the Internet. If you received the
E-Proxy Notice and would still like to receive a printed copy of our proxy materials without charge, you should follow the instructions for requesting such materials included in the E-Proxy Notice. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">4 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>I have received paper copies &#151; how do I receive future proxy materials electronically?
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">To sign up to receive stockholder communications electronically, follow the instructions on your proxy card or E-Proxy
Notice under &#147;Vote by Internet.&#148; You will need the 12-digit number that is printed in the box marked by the arrow <FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:'WINGDINGS 3'">&#103;</FONT>, which appears on your proxy card or E-Proxy Notice. This 12-digit
number is sometimes called the control number. In order to receive the communications electronically, you must have an e-mail account and access to the Internet. If you own your shares through a broker or other nominee, you may contact them directly
to request electronic access. Your consent to electronic access will be effective until you revoke it. You may revoke your consent by going to <U>www.proxyvote.com</U> and using the 12-digit number that is printed in the box marked by the arrow <FONT
STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:'WINGDINGS 3'">&#103;</FONT> to complete the revocation. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>What does it mean if I receive more than one E-Proxy Notice or
set of proxy materials? </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Your shares are likely registered differently or are in more than one account. For each notice,
proxy and/or voting instruction card or e-mail notification you receive that has a 12-digit number, you must vote separately to ensure that all shares you own are voted. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>What constitutes a quorum? </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The presence, in person or by proxy, of the
holders of a majority of ITW shares entitled to vote at our Annual Meeting constitutes a quorum. Your shares will be considered part of the quorum if you return a signed and dated proxy card or if you vote by telephone or Internet. Abstentions and
broker non-votes are counted as &#147;shares present&#148; at the meeting for purposes of determining if a quorum exists. A broker non-vote occurs when your bank, broker or other holder of record holding shares for you as the beneficial owner
submits a proxy that does not indicate a vote as to a non-routine proposal because that holder has not received voting instructions from you and, therefore, does not have voting authority for that proposal. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>What vote is required to approve each proposal, assuming a quorum is present? </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>Election of Directors:</I></B>&nbsp;&nbsp;The number of shares voted &#147;FOR&#148; a director must exceed the number of shares
voted &#147;AGAINST&#148; that director to constitute approval by the stockholders. <B><I> </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>Ratification of the
Appointment of our Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm:</I></B>&nbsp;&nbsp;The affirmative vote of a majority of the shares present in person or by proxy at the Annual Meeting and entitled to vote will constitute approval by the
stockholders. <B><I> </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>Advisory (Non-Binding) Vote on ITW&#146;s Executive Compensation:</I></B>&nbsp;&nbsp;The
affirmative vote of a majority of the shares present in person or by proxy at the Annual Meeting and entitled to vote will constitute approval by the stockholders. <B><I> </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>Approval of the Illinois Tool Works Inc. 2015 Long-Term Incentive Plan:</I></B>&nbsp;&nbsp;The affirmative vote of a majority of
the shares present in person or by proxy at the Annual Meeting and entitled to vote will constitute approval by the stockholders. <B><I> </I></B></FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>Approval of a Non-Binding Stockholder Proposal to Permit Stockholders to Call Special Meetings:</I></B>&nbsp;&nbsp;The affirmative vote of a majority of the shares present in person or by proxy at
the Annual Meeting and entitled to vote will constitute approval by the stockholders. <B><I> </I></B></FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">5 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>What is the effect of a broker non-vote generally and on each proposal? </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">A broker non-vote occurs when a broker or other nominee does not receive voting instructions from the beneficial owner and does not have
the discretion to direct the voting of the shares. Broker non-votes will be counted for purposes of calculating whether a quorum is present at the Annual Meeting, but will not be counted for purposes of determining the number of votes present in
person or represented by proxy and entitled to vote with respect to a particular proposal. Broker non-votes will not, therefore, impact our ability to obtain a quorum and will have no effect on the election of directors, ratification of the
appointment of our Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm, approval of ITW&#146;s executive compensation, approval of the Illinois Tool Works Inc. 2015 Long-Term Incentive Plan, or approval of the non-binding stockholder proposal. </FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>What if I &#147;abstain&#148; from voting? </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">An abstention on the election of directors will have no effect on the outcome. An abstention on the other proposals will have the effect of a vote against those proposals. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>How do I submit a stockholder proposal for the 2016 Annual Meeting? </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">To be considered for inclusion in our proxy statement for our May 2016 Annual Meeting, a stockholder proposal must be received no later than November&nbsp;21, 2015. Your proposal must be in writing and
must comply with the proxy rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission, or SEC. You should send your proposal to our Secretary at our address on the cover of this proxy statement. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">You also may submit a proposal that you do not want included in the proxy statement, but that you want to raise at our May 2016 Annual
Meeting. We must receive your proposal in writing on or after January&nbsp;9, 2016, but no later than February&nbsp;8, 2016. As detailed in the advance notice procedures described in our by-laws, for a proposal other than the nomination of a
director to be properly brought before an annual meeting, your notice of proposal must include: (1)&nbsp;your name and address, as well as the name and address of the beneficial owner of the shares, if any; (2)&nbsp;the number of shares of ITW stock
owned beneficially and of record by you and any beneficial owner as of the date of the notice (which information must be supplemented as of the record date); (3)&nbsp;a description of certain agreements, arrangements or understandings entered into
by you or any beneficial owner with respect to the shares (which information must be supplemented as of the record date) or the business proposed to be brought before the meeting; (4)&nbsp;any other information regarding you or any beneficial owner
that would be required under the SEC&#146;s proxy rules and regulations; and (5)&nbsp;a brief description of the business you propose to be brought before the meeting, the reasons for conducting that business at the meeting, and any material
interest that you or any beneficial owner has in that business. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>How do I nominate a director? </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">If you wish to nominate an individual for election as a director at our May 2016 Annual Meeting, our Secretary must receive your written
nomination on or after January&nbsp;9, 2016, but no later than February&nbsp;8, 2016. As detailed in the advance notice procedures described in our by-laws, for a nomination to be properly brought before an annual meeting, your notice of nomination
must </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">6 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">
include: (1)&nbsp;your name and address, as well as the name and address of the beneficial owner of the shares, if any; (2)&nbsp;the number of shares of ITW stock owned beneficially and of record
by you and any beneficial owner as of the date of the notice (which information must be supplemented as of the record date); (3)&nbsp;a description of certain agreements, arrangements or understandings entered into by you or any beneficial owner
with respect to the shares (which information must be supplemented as of the record date); (4)&nbsp;the name, age and home and business addresses of the nominee; (5)&nbsp;the principal occupation or employment of the nominee; (6)&nbsp;the number of
shares of ITW stock that the nominee beneficially owns; (7)&nbsp;a statement that the nominee is willing to be nominated and serve as a director; (8)&nbsp;a statement as to whether the nominee, if elected, intends to tender his or her resignation in
accordance with our Corporate Governance Guidelines; (9)&nbsp;an undertaking to provide any other information required to determine the eligibility of the nominee to serve as an independent director or that could be material to stockholders&#146;
understanding of the nominee&#146;s independence; and (10)&nbsp;any other information regarding you, any beneficial owner or the nominee that would be required under the SEC&#146;s proxy rules and regulations had our Board of Directors nominated the
individual. Any nomination that you make must be approved by our Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee, as well as by our Board of Directors. The process for the selection of director candidates is described under &#147;Corporate Governance
Policies and Practices&nbsp;&#151; Director Candidate Selection Process&#148; below. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Who pays to prepare, mail and solicit the proxies?
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">We will pay the cost of solicitation of proxies including preparing, printing and mailing this proxy statement and the
E-Proxy Notice. We will also authorize brokers, dealers, banks, voting trustees and other nominees and fiduciaries to forward copies of the proxy materials to the beneficial owners of ITW common stock. Upon request, we will reimburse them for their
reasonable expenses. In addition, our officers, directors and employees may solicit proxies in person, by mail, by telephone or otherwise. In the event that we decide to engage a proxy solicitation firm to assist with the solicitation of proxies, we
would expect to engage Georgeson, and we estimate that the additional cost to be borne by us would be approximately $12,000 plus reasonable and approved out-of-pocket expenses. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">7 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="4"><B><A NAME="tx821225_2"></A>Proposal 1 &#151; Election of Directors </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Stockholders are being asked to elect the eleven directors named in this proxy statement at our Annual Meeting. The individuals listed
below have been nominated by the Board of Directors as recommended by the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee. See &#147;Corporate Governance Policies and Practices&#148; for more information regarding our candidate selection process. Each
director will serve until the May 2016 Annual Meeting, until a qualified successor director has been elected, or until he or she resigns or is removed. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">We will vote your shares as you specify on the proxy card, by telephone, by Internet or by mail. If you do not specify how you want your shares voted, we will vote them &#147;FOR&#148; the election of all
the nominees listed below. If unforeseen circumstances (such as death or disability) make it necessary for the Board of Directors to substitute another person for any of the nominees, we will vote your shares &#147;FOR&#148; that other person. The
Board of Directors does not anticipate that any nominee will be unable to serve. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Each nominee for director brings a strong
and unique background and set of skills to the Board, giving the Board as a whole competence and experience in a variety of areas. Set forth below is biographical information provided by the nominees, as well as a description of the experiences,
qualifications, skills and attributes that led the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee and the Board to conclude that each nominee should serve as a director of the Company. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="81%"></TD></TR>


<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em">


<IMG SRC="g821225g56p82.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>Daniel J. Brutto,</I></B> 58, retired as President of UPS International and Senior Vice President of United Parcel Service,
Inc., a global package delivery, supply chain management and freight forwarding company, having served in these capacities from January 2008 to June 2013. Previously, he served as President, Global Freight Forwarding, for UPS from 2006 to 2007, and
corporate controller from 2004 to 2006. Mr. Brutto had over 38 years of experience at UPS, serving over the years in various areas with increasing levels of responsibility, including operations, finance, information systems, mergers &amp;
acquisitions, marketing, business development and international. Mr. Brutto is currently a Director of Innotrac Corporation, a privately held global fulfillment, customer care and technology company, and has served as a director of ITW since 2012.
He has not served as a director of any other publicly-traded company in the last five years. In the past, Mr. Brutto served on the board of the US-China Business Council, the Guangdong Economic Council, and the Turkey Economic Advisory Council. He
was also a delegate to the World Economic Forum, Davos, Switzerland, from 2009 to 2013.</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Mr. Brutto&#146;s significant strategic, operational, and financial leadership experience with a major global company, including the establishment of operations in 35 countries, along with his significant
international business experience, brings valuable perspectives to our Board.</FONT></P></TD></TR>
</TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">8 </FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="center">

<TR STYLE="font-size:1pt">

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em">


<IMG SRC="g821225g91y25.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>Susan Crown,</I></B> 56, has served as Vice President of Henry Crown and Company, a business with diversified investments,
since 1984. Ms.&nbsp;Crown is currently a director of Northern Trust Corporation and its subsidiary, The Northern Trust Company, and has not served as a director of any other publicly-traded company in the last five years. Ms.&nbsp;Crown has served
as a director of ITW since 1994. Ms.&nbsp;Crown&#146;s experience includes executive experience in diversified manufacturing, cellular phone, home furnishings and real estate businesses.</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Ms. Crown&#146;s long-standing board service at a global banking and financial
institution and her extensive board service with many civic and not-for-profit organizations bring valuable perspectives to our Board.</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-size:1pt">
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em">


<IMG SRC="g821225g64x86.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>James W. Griffith,</I></B> 61, retired as President and Chief Executive Officer of The Timken Company, a manufacturer of
bearings, alloy and specialty steels and components, having served in that capacity from 2002 to 2014. Previously, he served as President and Chief Operating Officer from 1999 to 2002. Mr.&nbsp;Griffith joined Timken in 1984, and held positions in
various functional areas of Timken with increasing levels of responsibility, including purchasing and logistics, manufacturing and international operations. From 1996 to 1999, he led Timken&#146;s automotive business in North America and
Timken&#146;s bearing business activities in Asia and Latin America. Prior to joining Timken, he held production and engineering positions at Martin Marietta, Bunker Hill Company and Homestake Mining Company. Mr. Griffith is currently a director of
AB Volvo Sweden, a commercial transport solutions company, and has served as a director of ITW since 2012. He previously served as a director of The Timken Company from 1999 to 2014 and Goodrich Corporation from 2002 to 2012, as well as a director
of the US-China Business Council and a number of other industry and not-for-profit organizations.</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Mr. Griffith&#146;s extensive experience as Chief Executive Officer of a global industrial manufacturer, along with his international business and engineering experience, bring valuable perspectives to
our Board.</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">9 </FONT></P>

market and shopper information, since 2013. He served as an operating partner with Friedman Fleischer &amp; Lowe LLC, a private equity firm, from 2011 to August 2014, at which time he became a senior advisor. From 2001 through 2007 he served as

global business services, technology and document management company, since January 2015. Since 1984, Mr.&nbsp;Warren has held a number of positions at Xerox with increasing levels of responsibility, including serving as President of Strategic

Mr.&nbsp;Warren has served as a director of ITW since 2010 and has not served as a director of any other publicly-traded company in the last five years.</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

</B></FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">12 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="4"><B><A NAME="tx821225_3"></A>Board of Directors and Its Committees </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The Company&#146;s Board of Directors met five times during 2014. In addition to these Board meetings, directors attended meetings of
Board committees. Non-employee directors, all of whom are independent, met five times in regularly scheduled executive sessions in conjunction with regular board meetings. Robert S. Morrison serves as non-executive Chairman of the Board. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">As stated in the Company&#146;s Corporate Governance Guidelines, the Board believes that it is in the best interests of the Company to
examine whether the roles of Chairman and Chief Executive Officer should be combined each time the Board elects a new chief executive officer. E. Scott Santi was elected President and CEO in November 2012, after the death of David B. Speer, our
former CEO. The Board decided to separate the roles of CEO and Chairman at that time and elected Robert S. Morrison, who was then lead director, as non-executive Chairman. Our Corporate Governance Guidelines also state that the Board has the
discretion to combine or separate the offices of CEO and Chairman at such time or times as it deems appropriate. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The Board of
Directors has standing audit, compensation, corporate governance and nominating, finance, and executive committees. Under the terms of their respective charters, each member of the audit, compensation, and corporate governance and nominating
committees must meet applicable New York Stock Exchange (&#147;NYSE&#148;) and SEC independence requirements. The Company strongly encourages its directors to attend all Board and committee meetings and the Annual Meeting of Stockholders. In 2014,
during the time they were serving, all of the directors attended at least 75% of the meetings of the Board and the committees on which they serve, and all of the directors except Anr&eacute; Williams attended our 2014 Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Audit Committee </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The Audit Committee is responsible for the engagement of our independent registered public accounting firm and assists the Board with respect to matters involving and overseeing accounting, financial
reporting and internal audit functions. In addition, the Committee is responsible for the integrity of the Company&#146;s financial statements, compliance with legal and regulatory requirements, the independence and performance of ITW&#146;s
independent registered public accounting firm, and the performance of the Company&#146;s internal audit function. Finally, the Audit Committee, on behalf of the Board of Directors, reviews and evaluates certain of our policies and practices with
respect to risk assessment and risk management and steps taken by management to monitor and control such exposures. Additional information on the Committee and its activities is set forth under &#147;Audit Committee Report&#148; below. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Compensation Committee </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The Compensation Committee establishes and oversees executive compensation policies, including issues relating to pay and performance,
targeted positioning and pay mix. The Compensation Committee recommends to the other independent directors compensation for the chief executive officer, reviews and approves the chief executive officer&#146;s recommendations regarding the
compensation of our other executive officers, and makes recommendations regarding new incentive compensation and equity-based plans or amendments to any existing plans. The Compensation Committee also is responsible for reviewing and evaluating
risks arising from our compensation policies and practices and providing input to management on whether such policies and practices may have a material adverse effect on the Company. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">13 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Under its charter, the Compensation Committee may retain an independent compensation
consultant or other advisors. The Compensation Committee engaged Frederic W. Cook&nbsp;&amp; Co., an independent consultant (&#147;Cook&#148;), as its independent advisor to review the Company&#146;s overall executive compensation program, review
the peer group of companies used by the Compensation Committee for comparison purposes and assess our compensation governance process. Based on representations from Cook and executive officers and directors of the Company, the Compensation Committee
has determined that Cook and its individual compensation advisor to the committee are independent. See &#147;Compensation Discussion and Analysis &#151; Role of Compensation Consultants.&#148; </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Additional information on the Compensation Committee, its activities, its relationship with its compensation consultant and the role of
management in setting compensation is provided under &#147;Compensation Discussion and Analysis&#148; below. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Corporate Governance and
Nominating Committee </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee identifies, evaluates and recommends director
candidates; develops, administers and recommends corporate governance guidelines; oversees the evaluations of the performance and procedures of the Board and individual directors; makes recommendations as to Board committees and Board size and makes
a recommendation to the Board regarding the Board&#146;s determination of director independence for the Board, the Audit Committee and the Compensation Committee. This committee also oversees and makes recommendations to the independent directors
regarding non-employee director compensation. See &#147;Corporate Governance Policies and Practices&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Director Candidate Selection Process&#148; below for a description of the director selection process. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Finance Committee </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The
Finance Committee reviews, evaluates and recommends management&#146;s proposals to the Board relating to the Company&#146;s financing and investment portfolio, and reviews and evaluates an annual summary of the funding and investment status of
significant benefit plans sponsored by the Company globally. The Finance Committee also periodically reviews and evaluates the Company&#146;s capital allocation strategy as well as risks arising from the Company&#146;s investments, treasury function
(such as derivatives and interest rates) and liquidity. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Executive Committee </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The Executive Committee may act on behalf of the Board if a matter requires Board action between meetings of the full Board. The Executive
Committee&#146;s authority in certain matters is limited by law and our by-laws. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">14 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Committee Memberships </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:7%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The following table shows the current committee membership and the number of meetings held by each committee during 2014. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="50%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="6%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="6%"></TD>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP> <P STYLE="border-bottom:1px solid #000000;width:28pt"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>Director</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="center" STYLE="border-bottom:1px solid #000000"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>Audit<BR>Committee</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="center" STYLE="border-bottom:1px solid #000000"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>Compensation<BR>Committee</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="center" STYLE="border-bottom:1px solid #000000"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>Corporate<BR>Governance<BR>and&nbsp;Nominating<BR>Committee</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
